title: Available Assembly Clarification...
body:
The documents state:

	DeepFaceLabCUDA9.2SSE  - For NVIDIA cards until GTX1080 and any 64-bit processors.
	DeepFaceLabCUDA10.1AVX - For NVIDIA cards up to RTX and processors with support for AVX.

I've seen other people question this as well, so to reduce ambiguity can you state if it's true that you indend this to mean the following:

	DeepFaceLabCUDA9.2SSE  - Intended for NVIDIA cards <= GTX 1080
	DeepFaceLabCUDA10.1AVX - Intended for NVIDIA cards >= GTX 1080 (up to an including the RTX cards).

If this is the case then I assume it means those are optimized for these ranges and therefore I should really be using my GTX 970 with the 9.2 SSE build instead of the 10.1 AVX build like I have been. I chose 10.1AVX because:

    a) My processor supports AVX.
    b) .. Given the choice I would think I would want to use the higher CUDA version.

But if it's going to slow down my older card then I, and others, surely would like to know so we can stay at the older CUDA version.

----

Also, there is no mention of the 'DeepFaceLabCUDA10.1SSE' builds, even though they are kept up to date as well. I have assumed that these are simply builds that have SSE, but not AVX. Is that correct?
 
---

Thanks man. This really is the best Deep Fake solution out there.
